Reviews.Title: “Excellent Honeymoon!!”
Reviews.Author: Kirstie W
Reviews.Content: After reading other reviews on here I was really not looking to staying here. How wrong could I be!! The Black Hotel is more than worth its four stars, the staff are friendly and very helpful. They helped us with directions no problem and printed out our vouchers for the vatican Museum, they tried their best to help after Air France failed to deliver our luggage by ringing around for us. Yes the location isn't brilliant but you know what people, check google maps!!! I knew before hand and was prepared however I wouldn't say it was badly located, there is a bus to the metro station it does get busy but the hotel offer a shuttle service, although it says complimentary it was 2 euro, well worth it!!! Straight to the Metro then another 1 euro to anywhere on the A line, or you could spend 4 euro to hop on off the metro, we paid just 1 euro as we chose to walk everywhere. There is a bank up to the hotel, however again I am not the fittest most lithe person but managed the bank without problem. I dispute the walk to catch the bus is long, 10 mins, you're visiting Rome, you're going to walk longer than that to see the sights!!! Breakfast was good, continental but could get scrambled eggs and bacon also, staff were always topping things up and there was plenty to go around, also a long breakfast period, 7.30 until 11am, excellent. On our last night I hurt my foot and could not walk well, the hotel were great, I wasn't hungry but my husband asked if it was possible he could eat in the room, no problem his meal was brought to the room within 20 mins, steak with potatoes cooked to perfection, with bread and dipping oil, also he ordered a fruit salad that came with a sort of creme brulee which was also excellent. The worst part of my honeymoon was Air France taking four days to deliver my luggage, I would without doubt stay here again and have recommended the hotel to my friends. I would suggest if you want a closer location pay the cost and stay in the city do not winge about the location surely the idea is to check before you book!! Don't blame the hotel for this!! I personally preferred the location and yes I did venture out after dark and felt completely safe. I found the hotel to be relaxing, rooms very clean yes you could hear people in other rooms but only because some people were loud no different to other hotels I've stayed in and this includes some ewell known top hotels!!, we had no bother sleeping , excellent facilities, brilliant!!! Can't wait to go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Location Terrible”
Reviews.Author: Lyn F
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Black Hotel with family for 4 nights in March, paid a very reasonable price with Groupon for the 4 star stay but definately not four star quality. Location was terrible had a long walk to catch a bus 246/247 into Cornilia, then had to catch metro into centre of Rome, too far to go back each evening to change for dinner so stayed out all day. Hotel itself very clean and modern with comfortable beds and rooms cleaned every day. Very little storage space in the bedrooms, no drawers and only 5 hangers so practically lived out of suitcase during our stay. Lovely bathroom with clean fresh towels although hairdryer was useless so take your own. Staff were unhelpfull and breakfast was the worst I have ever encountered for a hotel let alone a 4 star! Dirty tables, self service buffet if you could call it that! Each morning there were no cups, no hot water, no cold milk, no scrambled egg, no bacon, no crossants and one day they had no butter at all! The bread was so hard it bounced, and when we asked for things to be restocked it took forever, if at all. All in all a waste of time. In spite of the hotel we had a great time in Rome and will definately be returning again in the future.....but we will not be staying at the Black Hotel.

Reviews.Title: ““Disappointing””
Reviews.Author: Sue52England
Reviews.Content: The Black Hotel is not 4 star accommodation and not the most relaxing place to stay. The staff were unfriendly and we did not feel welcome. The hotel it’s self was modern, comfortable & clean with clean towels very day the hair dryer was rubbish so take you own. The hotel is too far away from Rome, every day we had to walk for 10 mins down a steep hill to catch a very crowded bus either the 246/247 to Cornelia, then a Metro into Rome, after a long day site seeing the last thing we wanted to do was walk back up that hill. The breakfast was very basic with a very limited choice, always having to ask for more plates, cups and food to be replaced on the buffet, there was never any cold milk for the cereal, no scrambled eggs or bacon the bread not very fresh, dirty tables were left & not cleared (we found the Italians did not move very quickly they worked at their pace). We paid a cheap price for this hotel with a Groupon deal, so, please do go to Rome it's truly amazing but don’t stay here choose a Hotel in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: paulaeddie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is awful arrived on a 3 day groupon deal no way 4 star terrible room rude staff food awful. We checked out after 1 night would rather pay for somewhere else . a very depressing place more like the black hole

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel a bit far out”
Reviews.Author: ceecee51
Reviews.Content: It was too far out and we had to get a taxi each day. The hotel itself is very good. We enjoyed a meal there and breakfast was also good. The rooms were very modern, comfortable and clean. Wifi wasn't working but was allowed to use the hotel's own in the office. The staff were helpful. Next time i would look for somewhere in the city.

Reviews.Title: “OK but would choose a different hotel next time”
Reviews.Author: 376kvetinka376
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is the worst aspect. You have to take a bus 246/247 to get to the nearest tube station and at the weekend it doesn't go that frequently (twice in an hour). If you go back to the hotel at night, it's quite scary, it's hidden in the hill and you have to walk in complete darkness. Another bad point was the main receptionist, a lady who was very unfriendly, unwelcoming and moody. We felt very unwelcome and was almost afraid to ask something. However, the evening male receptionist was very friendly and very helpful. The food was very basic, for a 4 star hotel I would expect higher standard. The room was very nice, it was on the second floor and it was very quiet, the bed was very comfortable. Overall, I think the hotel is average but because of the location I would choose a different hotel (closer to the city) next time.

Reviews.Title: “Unhelpful and moody staff”
Reviews.Author: Netball83
Reviews.Content: This hotel cannot be described as 4 star, it would be 3 at most. The location is really NOT convenient. I would pay the extra money and stay closer to the city centre, it cost around 12 euros to get from the hotel to the metro then 1 euro each for to metro to get to the sights (metro is great although takes 30 mins to get to centre). Taxi home in the evening cost 20-25 euros. The directions we were given were terrible and we ended up clambering up a hill and via another hotel to finally reach the hotel located behind a supermarket. Despite numerous phone calls to the hotel we were lost and had they advised us it would take over 2 and a half hours to get to the hotel from the airport we would have just got a taxi. When asking for taxis at the hotel or general advise, we were greeted by a moody and somewhat unhelpful receptionist. Breakfast was slow, always having to ask for more plates and food to be replaced on the buffet. The food itself was fine and what I would expect. The rooms were clean and comfortable beds. My advise-don't stay here, unless you don't mind spending 40 euros a day on transport (hotel shuttlebus as advertised doesn't exist!) and 2 hours getting to and from the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Really disappointing”
Reviews.Author: hotelguestworldwide
Reviews.Content: If you want to do the most of Rome and have a relaxing time, don't go to the Black Hotel. 1. If you as, receptionist will tell you it is easy to reacht he city BUT you have to walk on the road, then cross the supermarket car park, then a bridge, then wait for the bus next to a kind of freeway... then take the metro. Location is a nightmare. No public transport to come back. If you come to visit Rome PLEASE DON'T GO TO THAT HOTEL ! 2. Breakfast was included BUT it was a disaster. No cup, no pastries, no eggs, no place. No service. We gave up and had breakfast in Roma. 3. The room was nice, at least the bed BUT you can hear evyrything that's happenning in the corridor+ the neighbor's even when they just sit on the toilet !! Yes really ! 4. Stay there for 2 nights with a Groupon Voucher BUT Groupon Voucher was more expensive then the real price. Conclusion = Don't buy on Groupon.

Reviews.Title: “2 day stay March 2012”
Reviews.Author: Nik J
Reviews.Content: The hotel was ok, but assume you have a room with a bathroom that is clean and simple. It is not 4 star but is fine. Hotel itself is in a pretty basic part of town and is not walkable to anything you would want. From the airport it is about €35 in a taxi. To get into Rome you need to take the 247 bus to the vatican 20 mins (stay on until last stop doesnt operate on Sunday), or the 246 to metro stop Cornelia then take the subway (30-45mins). Tickets are purchased from the magazine shop between the cafe and the supermarket you cannot buy them on the bus. Standard single fare is €1 per person. Travelcard for 2-3 days is about €15. Note they had run out of tickets on sunday at the shop, however no one checks tickets on the bus Bus is on the opposite side of the road to the Panarama supermarket to head into town. Subway tickets are purchased in the subway station (€1 per person). If you want a decent bed and bathroom and plan to head into Rome in the morning and return in the evening to sleep it is fine, it is however not a resort. Cabs back from rome (wouldnt do bus and subway late and the subway finishes at 9.30pm (we went from the Piazza Nuavo) are about €15 however can be €30-35 from the far end of town. We found once in Rome you can walk anywhere and to all the attractions. Next time we would stay in town as it makes it easier to take a nap or relax during the day but overall black hotel was fine. One final note is that if you take a cab to the airport in the morning it is about €35-40 euro if you take a car from the hotel they charge a standard €50??? go figure.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Pandsy106
Reviews.Content: Rooms were very basic, but clean and the beds were comfortable. Decor (or lack thereof) was a bit unusual. When we used the shower in the room the floor flooded every time. Breakfast time was a disaster - not enough place settings even though the tables for two were empty. A couple from our group were barked at to share a table for four with another couple when they attempted to sit at an empty table for two. Clearly not enough staff to cope with breakfast time, food running out constantly, not enough cutlery, plates or even cups at one point. Found it very strange that there was no tourist information available in the hotel - re getting around etc. (our own guides were in our luggage which were stuck at the airport due to baggage handlers strike) and also we were given no info about the hotel itself eg room service, dinner etc when we checked in. It is close to the bus stop which is handy as a taxi cost us anything from €15 - €28 to get into the centre of Rome depending on the driver. Re transfers to and from airport - yes they can arrange them for €55 which we had done - however the driver left (without contacting us)as we were delayed waiting for our luggage. In the end we got a transfer for €40 from one of the shuttle drivers at the airport. Overall would not recommend

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Good Value - Inconvenient Location”
Reviews.Content: If this hotel was within walking distance of an underground station it would be an excellent tourist hotel. Although access to public transport is easy, and cheap, the addition of a bus ride from the underground station and then a 8 - 10 minute walk (up hill) makes it inconvenient if you want to go back for an afternoon rest period, Probably not suitable if elderly or an unsteady walker. However, that said, it is very good value for money. Yes the inside is dark but the rooms are bright, very comfortable and clean. Breakfast is typically 'continental', cold meat, cheese, cereals, if early scrambled eggs and bacon available. Buy a container and take enough to make a good lunch! Staff are very helpful but remember, this is Italy - not renowned for being very quick to react to customers! Supermarket is good, sells hot Pizza with a cafe attached. No restaurants within walking distance. Overall a nice place to stay, clean, modern but inconvenient.

Reviews.Title: “Black hotel”
Reviews.Author: kevin m
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable - not 4 star. A long way from the centre if you are bothered about travelling in Rome. Could do with a larger sign from the main road. Directions to hotel: Metro to Cornelia. Then bus 246 to the panorama supermarket. Walk up the supermarket entrance slip road, turn left at the top and follow signs. Not easy in the dark/1st time. Did not use any of the leisure facilities, too busy sight seeing. also cannot comment on the restaurant, but breakfast certainly set us up each day. Staff all pleasant and helpful. Very good value for the weekend deal we got. January 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: arabian-explorer
Reviews.Content: It was far from the city of rome but was interesting experiance the hotel was black! lol pretty cool. They had a pool out side it was freezing cold!! but the surrounding area was nice and quite.

Reviews.Title: “better than expected.”
Reviews.Author: user_nj40
Reviews.Content: I visited the hotel in september 2011 and due to reading reviews on trip advisor was a little worried however could not change the hotel due to travel agents. however I was overall satisfied. we arrived earlier than check in but our luggage was locked away until we returned back after our visit into the city centre. The journey DOES involve a bus and a metro HOWEVER its extremely cheap for both services and the lady at the reception sorted it all out for us even with her little English. The journey does take approx 45 minutes. however takes a about 1 hour on a Sunday due to waiting for the bus. The supermarket is extremely cheap and great for water at only 30c a bottle. (much better than buying in center as really expensive) The hotel room was on the third floor average size but fitted 3 of us comfortably with clean well kept en-suite with lovely shower however we was in a large group and the some of the males struggled with the slanted roof (but only due to being rather tall) Breakfast was average, plently of option but taste was not wonderful. Being a group on the last day we wanted to use the pool but it was not open even though we we read it was until November however on request they opened it, obviously cold but it was the end of September. safe would not open but on request someone sorted it out promptly. overall staff were friendly and helpful and for the value of money i would stay here again and recommended to anyone who doesnet mind walking to the bus stop and sitting on the bus/metro but when your with great company who cares :) ROME ITSELF IS AMAZING. ALTHOUGH WITH A GROUP OF FRIENDS STILL FOUND IT MAGICAL AND CANNOT WAIT TO RETURN. NOTE: up the side streets food is cheaper and nicer along with staff being more friendly. Look on websites for advice we did and found a lovely places to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Joanne1923
Reviews.Content: We visited the Black Hotel for a Christmas Break on 8th December. This hotel should not be a four star hotel for a start - rooms tiny and ours had black mould in although was generally clean. My partner was planning on proposing to me during the trip and had spoke to the hotel beforehand to ask if an upgrade would be possible - they said yes a romantic jacuzzi room was available and we could just pay the 30euro per night extra when we got there. When we arrived at the hotel the gentleman on reception informed us that the upgrade was no longer available and therefore no charge for this would be made. Admittidly we didn't spend a great deal of time in our room as we were there to see the sights of the city and the bus/metro links were convenient for travel although I would not like to travel this way after dark (taxis from the city centre back to the hotel cost around 20euro + dependent upon which part of the city you were in and if the taxi was metered or not). Although slightly disappointed by our room for the cost we tried to enjoy our stay and my boyfriend proposed on our first night (despite lack of upgraded room!). When we came to check out we were advised a charge of 72euro was payable. We knew 12euro of this was for the new travel tax italy has introduced (3euro per person, per night). When asked what the additional 60euro was for we were told it was for the 'romantic room' upgrade. We advised we had been told the romantic room was not available and therefore weren't expecting to pay this. We were then advised that the silk petals they had placed on the end of our bed in the shape of a heart, a rose and a few half used candles (with nothing available to light them with) was classed as a romantic room upgrade and therefore the charge was applicable! I don't think 30euros per night is an acceptable amount to charge for such a simple thing especially when we told we werent receiving this and wouldnt be getting charged! Added the fact that the housekeeper didn't even go into our room on our second day to make the bed and re-assemble the reusable silk petals!!!! We did advise the receptionist what we were told on our arrival but we still had to end up paying!! Overall its a shame that the hotel spoilt what should have been a very romantic and special time for us both. This hotel should not be a four star hotel - i have stayed in better Travellodges and Premier Inns than this place - the decor was dated and cheaply done and it is appalling that they charged us for an upgrade when we DID NOT receive one!

Reviews.Title: “nice stay”
Reviews.Author: slo_thiago
Reviews.Content: Was there for a trade fair in early october. the hotel is off the main street so you can hear no traffic which is very good. the room is quite good, bed is comfy, bathroom just big enough with shower. breakfast was medium quality, not much choice. true, everything is dark- even black... so if you're looking for bright colors you're in the wrong place. they have outside pool which eas closed; it was off season. final vedict: would stay again even though have no idea about available public transport near by. probably need your own car or have the reception call the taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Expected more...”
Reviews.Author: m13kcy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over Easter and knew it was far from city centre, but staff were helpful with directions. No shuttle bus and no swimming pool etc!!!! Food was great, although different. Staff werent overly friendly bar 1 waiter. Great looking hotel , but expected more for the price

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary Style Hotel, Far away from the centre!”
Reviews.Author: hayleybyrne040
Reviews.Content: The problem you have when you stay in such a busy, popular destinatuion as Rome you want to stay in the city centre you have to pay over the odds for a decent hotel. If you want to pay a less and get a little more you have to stay outside the city. I will start witth the positives and then the negatives. On the plus side this hotel has a clean, gorgeous swimming pool, perfect for when you have been trapsing around the dusty hot city to jump in this cold pool. The decor is modern but a little worn in some parts of our room. The breakfast is a delight the usual european affair with great coffee. The staff were very friendly and overall we were pleased. The downside was this hotel is at the top of a hill, down the hill is a supermarket car park, that leads to the bus stop. I fyou are heading back into town you need to use the foot bridge to travel back. Bearing in mind the supermarket car park closes at 9.30 in the evening, you are limited to a taxi fare if you are out past this time. I didnt mind the journey at first its fun using public transport aborad but if you go out for the day rerturn to shower then out in the evening the journey gets tiresome very quickly. Not suitable for older people. The journey is annoying. Thats my perseption of it but it is reasonable price wise and there are pros and cons.

Reviews.Title: “Nice with some remaks”
Reviews.Author: dolfieke
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, but far from the city - take a walk in the heat up the hill, then take the sometimes too hot bus and then the metro....Comming from the city, take a shower and decide to go back to the city....I advice you to be patient and learn all about the complicated public busses-system because the metro temporarely stops at 9 PM. My Airco and fridge did not work and the management didn't do anything about it. Positve: If you like black, it's the place to be for you! Everything is dark. The crew is nice when they get to know you, but their English is sometimes very poor...Breakfast is good, but no variation. All toghether a nice hotel, worth the money - a good 3 star!

Reviews.Title: “No idea how anyone can complain about this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: John H
Reviews.Content: It's not in the City Centre, but it isn;t difficult to get there. 20 minute bus/metro ride. Good food. Great pool. Friendly staff. Clean, spacious, light and well air conditioned rooms. Quiet at night, easy to sleep. Nice terrace to sit at should you decide to drink at the hotel. It's black.... It's called the BLACK HOTEL people. If you don;t want to stay in a Black Hotel, don't book a stay at the Black Hotel, perhaps?

Reviews.Title: “great staff, interesting decor!”
Reviews.Author: magically_delicious7
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel. Very well kept, and modern decorations. The staff was very friendly, we even made friends with the bartenders and spent some time with them. It was a bit far from the center of the city , but still easy to access with the bus system. We even took a bus to a beach in a neighbouring time which had black sand. I really liked my stay and would go again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel good for most things - and has a great look and feel to it.”
Reviews.Author: Pauki
Reviews.Content: We were moved to this hotel from its sister hotel, Scheppers, because that was so bad - and so were very pleased with the Black Hotel. The rooms were very clean and chic and funky and the whole place was quite different in feel. The staff were very helpful - the night manager was particularly friendly - and the food was good (breakfast was excellent, dinner was good, but a bit expensive). It's quite far from the centre, but we knew that before we went (and which is why the price for the 4* hotel is less than in the centre) and used the nearby public transport ok. I don't know if it's quite a 4*, but definitely a good 3*!!! Or only real problem was the air-con didn't work (but it did in the room next door for the person we were with!)

Reviews.Title: “black paint doesn't disguise the fact that this is a badly executed attempt at a boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: gucci_slave
Reviews.Content: Yes, the lobby edging towards cook by being dark and filled with ribbon couches, but a little cheap interior decorating magic doesn't make up for the fact that it is incredibly badly situated for a business or pleasure traveller - miles away from the metro and with no passing cabs and no good restaurants in walking distance. All in all it wasn't a memorable experience, but what did make a lasting impression was: - No internet in the rooms due to a problem which wasn't communicated - A gym that only opens at 10am - conveniently too late for a business traveller - A receptionist that actively ignored our polite requests including one for a taxi. A mistake that ultimately resulted in us being 45 mins late for our meeting.

Reviews.Title: “nightmare”
Reviews.Author: ritee
Reviews.Content: The hotel is so gloomy. Its black as the name states, "Black Hotel". It does not have any four stars criteria. It is out of the city centre. Once you enter the hotel, you are trapped. Breakfast is so horrible, the bread served seems to be stale. The chairs in the restaurant, are so uncomfortable. There is absolutely no level of comfort. It was really great when we finally changed hotel. Its a tin box, black. I guess Vampires might like the place. Gloomy and dark.

Reviews.Title: “it is exactly what it says on the tin!!”
Reviews.Author: MrsB130107
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 4 nights. as the name suggests, the hotel decor is extremely black! quite a small hotel but fine. housekeeping was everyday, breakfast was the usual hotel fayre that you get abroad. staff were polite and helpful, only drawback was we asked for the internet service in our room, they said they had been having problems with it but we could try and someone would come and have a look in an hour, but 2 hours later no-one had been so we went on with the rest of our day. but overall, the hotel was clean, it's not in the centre of the city but is easily reached by bus and metro, which sounds alot but didnt take long at all, and the metro tickets are so cheap, you dont mind. a 3 day ticket was 11 euros, and can be used on any public transport in the metro area. there is a supermarket at the bottom of the road, so we bought snacks and drinks from there rather than sitting in the hotel restaurant, as main meals we ate in the city centre. the roomss werent huge, but were clean, and at the end of the day, its just a place to rest your head!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel if you want to sleep at night”
Reviews.Author: saraswati_2
Reviews.Content: I stayed in room 303 for three nights. It rained every night, and the noise caused by the rain on the metal roof was terrible. The electric window curtain did not close well, which caused the room to be inundated by light every morning. There were humidity stains all over the room ceiling, the minibar refrigerator did not refrigerate (I told the reception, but it was not fixed), the cupboard space was small and awkward, the orange juice at breakfast was horribly sweet, etc. etc. Never again, Black hotel.

Reviews.Title: “If you're looking for something off the beaten path and like being in the dark.”
Reviews.Author: deniceandryan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Black Hotel because we were given a Smart Box as a wedding gift and this was the only hotel in Rome listed in the Smart Box that had availability. We stayed 2 nights. Few things to note before you book: 1. First off, it is way out of the way. 2. The hotel is painted black both inside and out. So it's ridiculously dark. Rooms have white interior walls, but the hallways are dark. It seriously reminded me of being in a club except I wasn't drunk and I always felt like someone was going to jump out and scare me. 3. Everything at this hotel you have to pay for (to watch local tv and internet in your room) 4. The Smart Box didn't work - not their fault, it's Smart Box, but if you happen to get one just make sure they send an email verification to them. Our experience: The 2 taxis we took to get there didn't know where it was. Thank goodness, the second one had a gps. Cost is approximately 15-20 euro or 60 euro if you get trapped like us. In retrospect, we realized you could actually take the metro and bus over there. From the train station, take the metro to Cornelia station, then take the 246 or 247 towards Via Bogliasco. You will get off at the Panorama Supermarket. Walk through the parking lot, up the ramp, then make a hard left at the top of the ramp. Walk 1/4 mile then make a left at the fork. The hotel will be the 2nd driveway on the right. This will save you a lot of $$, but as I said before it's off in the boondocks, so if you get there at night, beware it's dark. Aside from the Panorama Supermarket and a small little tobacco stand that sells pizza, there's nothing to eat around here. So we ate at the hotel restaurant which was decent, nothing to write home about except for their rosemary breadsticks with salt. :) Hotel staff is friendly and nice. Room - they have a towel heater rack which is good if you need to dry clothes. The rack that holds the towel is ridiculously high (seriously around 6 feet off the ground), I know this because I am 4'10" and could not reach the towels. Sad situation there. Something to note - if you take a shower in the morning, take it early because they run out of hot water. There was a tour group at our hotel and they left early. All of them got warm showers. At night warm water is fine. Room cleanliness - the big thing to note with our room was that there were bed bugs. I've never experienced this before so I was pretty grossed out. I showered in the AM and PM before I went to bed. I was reading and got bit several times while sitting there. My husband also woke up to many bites. These were not mosquito bites either. Rather unpleasant. Few things they could do to make the experience better - 1. Run the shuttle to the metro station more often and both ways. 2. Clean the rooms a bit better 3. Lower the towel rack and make sure things like the trash can are not broken. 4. Advertise the bus route on your website.

Reviews.Title: “take it or leave it attitude - completely unhelpful staff - too remote”
Reviews.Author: MontyMillie
Reviews.Content: Staff who could not care less and offered no help to stop our air con from running all night; reception gave wrong advice on local travel and found that amusing; the hotel is not as close to the City centre as they would have you believe; the staff in the breakfast restaurant believe themselves to be budding chefs in fact they were less than helpful and finished serving 30 minutes before the published time; loved Italy and adored Rome but absolutely hated this hotel and would encourage anyone to keep looking if this hotel drops into your search results - we will never go there again.

Reviews.Title: “don't go there”
Reviews.Author: pulpfiction7
Reviews.Content: -The hotel is not in Rome! If you want to visit the city of Rome you first need to take a crowded bus, overwin the traffic jams and then finally get into the metro. To reach the center you have to travel about 60 minutes if you get lucky! -When I complaint that the air-conditiong wasn't working staff told me "i suggest you open the window!" It was 30 degrees celcius! -The pick-up at the airport: charges are 55 EUR (15 minutes drive) -The swimming pool was closed: every day we were told it would open the next day (we stayed 9 nights...) -Although it was our honey moon, we didn't get an upgrade or a bottle of champagne... Any decent hotel would atleast offer a bottle of champagne...

Reviews.Title: “Rude people, mediocre hotel”
Reviews.Author: Opinionated58
Reviews.Content: Arrived at 10:00 a.m. and we were rudely told, after a 17 hr trip, that entry was at 2:00 pm but would see if they could get us in. We waited 1.5 hour in their cafeteria and decided to take a tour of the city and receptionist commented that it was better since we would not be let in until 2:00 pm. We came back to a room around 90 degrees F and found out that they don't have air conditioning, only during the summer months. We were told that if we waited a couple of hours it would cool off. We left!!

Reviews.Title: “My Home from Home in Rome”
Reviews.Author: NikkieB
Reviews.Content: Ended up almost living here for 10 months and cannot fault the staff, the rooms, the ambience or the food. I still recommend this hotel and it's sister in "Le Marche" to anyone coming to Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Not again for us.”
Reviews.Author: Dutch_TA
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked this hotel to visit Rome. When we arrived, we had to wait till the reception lady was finished with her phone calls and paper work. She first looked amazed when we checked in. She gave us the feeling we were not very welcome. Everything was too much work for her. We booked the superior room with A Jacuzzi and small terraces. The room looked very sterile and had not much atmosphere. The bathroom was clean and had also the atmosphere as the name of the hotel “Black.” To bad the trash can in the bathroom looked like it was crashed between the door or something, should be replaced in a four star hotel. The air-conditioning did its job and kept the warmth outside. The beds were standard and were ok for two nights. One complains to the bathroom, when we used the shower the bathroom and corridor was flood with water, it almost reached the bed. When we complained to the reception staff, the lady sent a technical man that discovered the kit around the bath was not all right. The lady of the reception said it was no problem for our stay. I had the feeling she said this to more customers as the kit problems were not from one day to another. They really seemed not to be amazed. The restaurant of the Hotel we tried for one evening was good. We ate some fine food although the price was a little bit too high. The two men of the restaurant and the bar were very kind and helpful and although their English was bad they did everything to understand you. This is the opposite to the reception lady. The breakfast was complementary and standard. They offered enough for everybody’s needs and there was also plenty of food available. It was also possible to eat on the terrace. The location of the Hotel is not so good. To get to the center you first have to walk to the bus stop and take the bus to the nearest metro station. The metro brings you further to the city center. Although we didn’t have problems to getting in the center and back to the hotel but it isn’t easy. The shuttle service of the hotel we didn’t use but reading the terms of use it was totally useless in our opinion. The way to the hotel is full of garbage and had an unpleasant smell. Glass could be found everywhere near the road so it seemed not to be a very save neighborhood although we didn’t have problems with that. The Hotel offers also a swimming pool but don’t expect a very large pool, it isn’t. Because of the pool there were also a lot of mosquitoes that did bite you very nasty. My wife had purple spots on her body that were as large as a tennis ball and we were wondering if they weren’t Tiger mosquitos’ as more tripadvisor reviewers had these problems. But this isn’t something the hotel can do about. Over all we can’t recommend this hotel to others. The reception lady Elena, the floating bathroom, the poor shuttle service, the high restaurant prices, the location and finally the mosquitos are for us the reason not to come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “FORGET IT! NEVER AGAIN!”
Reviews.Author: wendyda
Reviews.Content: The service was very unfriendly and unprofessional. The air conditioning did not work at all! The shower has a high of 1,5 meter (slating position) you will surely bump your head! Very far from the city center. Again.......the service was very unfriendly and unprofessional.

Reviews.Title: “It was good. Clean. Nice design. Quiet.”
Reviews.Author: nbisp
Reviews.Content: It is better if you have a car or you use the taxi to arrive the hotel at the evening. Only the meal in the hotel has room for improvement. I am contented.

Reviews.Title: “A Truly Terrible Experience!”
Reviews.Author: sharonco
Reviews.Content: This was supposed to be the venue for a weeks holiday to celebrate a significant birthday. The room we were given had broken air conditioning which we reported to reception as the temperature in room was 30+ degrees celcius. The fix did not work and the managements solution was to advise us to open the windows. This resulted in several of the party being bitten by insects which required one of the party to seek medical attention resulting in an injection and a course of antibiotics. After the first night of sweltering room conditions we went back to reception where we were treated with disdain and rudeness by both the reception staff and managers. They were extremely unhelpful and patronising. In addition to this both dinner and breakfast was disorganised chaos and the standard of the food and service was awful. To add insult to injury we were charged a cancellation fee when we decided to leave after one night, even though the hotel had not provided the terms and conditions they had agreed to. My advice would be to choose another hotel, unless you like rude, patronising and unhelpful service. Poor food and hot bedrooms.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT GO HERE!!! cool by name not by nature”
Reviews.Author: beeco
Reviews.Content: After arriving at this hotel which is 7 long kms to rome we were placed in a clean and hip spacious room which was 30 degrees celcius. Having been down to ask about our air conditioning we were assured this was turned on by an extremely rude and unhelpful staff member. We returned to our room after having the worst meal served to me by the poorest staff and our room was still unbearably hot. I returned to reception to enquire about this and was told to open my window. This lead to several members of my party being bitten by insects in the night. The next day i hastily left the Black Hotel taking my happy memories and my blistering flesh with me and moved to a a brillant hotel in rome with functioning air condition and staff with manners.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Stunning”
Reviews.Author: morgansmammy
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 7 nights in Rome, staying at The Black Hotel, and have to say that we absolutely loved it. The design and interior is modern and well thougtht out, the staff were very friendly and couldnt do enough, the pool was stunning (loved the black mosaic tiles) and the rooms were clean and tidy, and were serviced everyday. There is a shuttle bus that runs to Cornelia (nearest metro link) at 9.30am and 10.30am everyday, but you have to book onto it the night before, however, we didnt bother, as across the road there is a public transport bus (the 246) that takes you to Cornelia every 15 minutes. If you, as we did, have trouble getting to the hotel (because its new and not many people have heard of it), take the A line metro to Cornelia, where there is a small bus station, then jump on the 246 bus, getting off at the PANORAMA. If you look up beyond the panorama you will see the Jolly Hotel Midas......make your way for there and the Black is a stones throw to the right. The hotel is expensive to eat at (the only down side), but across the road from the panorama is a huge camp site that has a reasonable restaurant, which we found very good. All in all, we had a fab time sightseeing around Rome, which was made all that more enjoyable because of this hotel. I would not hesitate in recommending it to my family and friends and would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A Rome Hotel with a difference!”
Reviews.Author: rafi7
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights and have no complaints. Its not cheap but well worth the money. The staff were helpful and polite, the breakfast was really tasty especially the croissants with nutella and doughnuts my 6year old couldnt get enough. There is a free shuttle bus from the hotel into Rome centre 10mins drive away then we got on the Metro to get around Rome very easy. If you want a swim after a day walking round Rome , have style this is the hotel for you

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings about Black Hotel”
Reviews.Author: johnnybench
Reviews.Content: We found the staff at Black Hotel to be helpful and accommodating to our requests. Certainly the hotel is clean and the room comfortable. We ate breakfast each morning as well as one dinner at the restaurant and had nothing to complain about. While interesting and stylish, the very modern design of the hotel lacks warmth. In the evening, the lobby lighting is very subdued, perhaps it is too dark, and therefore is not particularly welcoming. As others have noted, the hotel is situated somewhat out of the city, and is not conveniently located near public transportation. We experienced the same difficulty in getting to and from the hotel by bus, and strongly recommend that you plan to take a taxi into and out of the city. Since the hotel was not known by three of the taxi drivers we used, we told them to take us to the Jolly 'Meedas' as a previous poster had suggested, which worked like a charm!

Reviews.Title: “If you want terrible service and rude check in staff, this is the hotel for you”
Reviews.Author: Peter_12325
Reviews.Content: If you want Rude Check in Staff, that say they don't understand and then mumble under their breath, rude obscenitys, this is the hotel for you. It is about a 30 Euro taxi ride to the heart of Rome. The pool is not open until 10am in the morning, and then closes at 7pm. At night there are street workers at the supermarket store close by and also pick pocketers. This would have to be one of the most modern hotels i have stayed at. The rooms are nice, not sure about space to put clothing away though. Just dont expect the check in staff to be friendly. I continually had the check in Blond lady, play on the computer and had me waiting for about 10mins (this was done to all guests) . When she was done, she made people feel terrible for interrupting, and then said that she did not understand english. I am italian and i can tell you she definately understood and made fun of people who did not understand. I will never stay at the this hotel, as it would have the rudest check in staff and very unhelpful. If there are 2 of you, they will make the 2nd person pay an extra 30 Euro per night, so please be careful when checking rates.

Reviews.Title: “rome escape”
Reviews.Author: sarinni
Reviews.Content: it is an issue the fact that its so far away from the center walk + bus + metro to the center is a bit of a bummer and taxi every day can be expensive. the service is not as good as it could be and neither is the breakfast (you would expect more from this kind of place) apart from that the hotel is cool (and a bit dark, some call it modern). The swimming pool was great after a tourist day round rome, but forget about the meals there, they are not up for it. The bed is confy and the bathroom is well equiped. I don't like the fact that the light comes in the room in the morning, but most hotels are like that...

Reviews.Title: “nice rooms, a little far for tourists.”
Reviews.Author: torokc
Reviews.Content: Nice service, and breakfast. nice looking rooms. only complaint was it was a little bit of a pain to get back into the main tourist area each day. not reccommended if your time is limited and you dont want to pay a taxi to get to city every day. otherwise u need to train and bus it everyday, thats like an hour each way.

Reviews.Title: “Decent and clean”
Reviews.Author: dottorsocrates
Reviews.Content: Far away from the center, but cheap. Staff helpul. Good breakfast but the restaurant has a short menù. We stayed there 2 nights but the did not changed the menu. The main problems are that the water in the bathroom is not too hot and the hotel has a nice terrace but not a garden.

Reviews.Title: “Black Hotel: You've got the look!”
Reviews.Author: brunorodrigues
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel even after reading the reviews and knowing it was far away from the city center. Due to budget constraints, the other hotels considered were at the same distance from the city center but didn't look as new and modern as Black Hotel did. But we chose it nevertheless. Unlike previous reviews, we found the staff to be relentless and talkative in every single occasion we needed them. - Getting the airport phone number and calling them every now and then to give us updates about our missing luggage. Calling us on our mobile (international call, remember) to tell us the luggage had just arrived - Calling for taxis and booking restaurants - Help us finding our way to the city center and numerous roman landmarks using the very complex transport system Breakfast was par to most of the hotels we've seen in the category. Can't speak about the meals, because we had none at the restaurant. Judging by the affluence, i'd say it's pretty popular. The rooms were a little smaller than we'd expect, but nothing claustrophobic. Good fluffy pillows and a very clean and distinct look all around. Very very good taste in decoration, lighting and overall look. In my personal oppinion, the variety of foreign TV channels should be bigger (most italian, bbc world, a spanish, a french and a german channel). Sure getting out of the hotel to the city center and back is a nightmare and takes a long time. Watch out for bus timetables, which can be tricky. There is no 274 (which ends at the Cipro/Vatican Museum Metro station) at weekends and holidays so take one that gets by a Metro station. And if you ever use a taxi to get back to the hotel, it's probable that they don't know where the Black Hotel is. In this case, just tell them it's close to the Midas Hotel (don't you dare to call it Jolly Hotel Midas, because there are a hundred Jolly hotels around and they'll get even more confused). It'll help.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, very far out”
Reviews.Author: clarefromessex
Reviews.Content: The hotel looked great on the website - very modern, futeristic, clean with a swimming pool. No directions on the website of how to get there however. It is quite far out of Rome - around 10 - 20 euros to Vatican city for instance. The tube only goes so far and then you have to get a cab, and around 2km to the nearest tube along a dangerous route to walk. Not especailly ideal if you want to go back to the hotel for a rest during the day. They do have a shuttle bus which they don't advertise, but gets booked up, only three a day and only one way. The hotel was lovely - rooms very clean, nice beds and bathroom. The hotel receptionsionist was very rude however - everything too much trouble - including calling a cab which made my husband late for a meeting. Food was great however and had a fab meal in the restaurant. Didn't get a chance to try out the swimming pool as was raining when we were there.

Reviews.Title: “A Trek from Rome”
Reviews.Author: poppinjays1
Reviews.Content: The hotel is at least an hour to the centre, by various means of transport unlike what internet descriptions say. They do provide a shuttle service to Cornelia 3 times a day but only for the journey in. You have to make your own way back by metro line A, which shuts at 9pm and number 246 or 247 bus which is subject to pickpockets. The hotel is faultless staff are very obliging and the breakfast was great considering continental. Can not comment on meals but the restaurant was always busy. The pool is wonderful a haven from the scorching sun. There is not many bars or restaurants but Sunset Hill a campsite across the mainroad allows entry aslong as you leave by 11pm, plus they do great pizza for the journey home. The only problem is you have climb the embankment as the Panorama gates to the supermarket shut at 9.30pm. The only gripe is the early alarm call roughly 6.45am onwards laundry trolleys seem to be pushed along the concret/marble floor, do not accept room 106 unless you like the alarm call! Overall great hotel just wish it was closer to the centre of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “usefull info for the hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: [We have just returned from 2 weeks Italy where we went all over and this was the one hotel we booked. We were really looking forward to this one, the promised luxury on the website seemed to good to be true... and it was. It started with wanting to go for a dip... there is currently only a concrete bassin in the back garden and no decking is present. Looked a lot better on the website...it was an actual pool. Upon talking to the deskstaff they offered us a room in another close by hotel with pool but the extra 40 Euros a night would be at our expense... so we stayed. This hotel is not a mere few minutes away from Vatican city, as advertised; it will take you an hour by public transport and a taxi will cost you about 30 Euros. One way. Pay per view movies are dubbed in Italian and, breakfast never seemed to have any fresh bread. If you go for a polished veneer look and you do not mind being away out of the center it is a good deal at the price we got it,120Euro. You are still staying in Rome. They got the design right of the place but that is unfortunately all. To top it all off; they messed up our bill and charged our credit card, once we left the hotel; with an extra 400 Euros!!!! Our current bill with this place stands at over 700 Euros for a 3 night stay. we now have the pleasure of dealing with the bank to sort this one out!!! All in all, not a very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Want a Swim After A Hot Day in the City!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Beware if booking this Hotel in the near future - publishes that it has a swimming pool, one of the reasons we chose this Hotel. Sadly this is not the case it is merely a big hole in the ground and no where near completion. Very dis-appointing and staff not very interested in my concern.

Reviews.Title: “An Italian gem”
Reviews.Author: gpvinitaly
Reviews.Content: First and foremost I will say that this hotel is beautiful, inside and out. It's set back from the road so traffic noise is not an issue, it's close enough not to be a hassle getting into the town centre (1 hour including the walk to the bus stop, the bus ride, the metro ride and any waiting - a 1 euro ticket each way is all you need), and it's new so everything has that nice feeling that everything new does. The customer service wasn't amazing, but then I believe that to be a fault of Italians themselves, as apposed to the hotel - they were still polite and courteous however so don't let that put you off. A taxi transfer is 55 euros from Ciampino airport, and is one hell of a journey owing to their manic driving style. The minibar was frighteningly expensive (moreso than 5 star hotels I've stayed in in the past), and room service is 5 euros per person on top of the meal price. The food is far better in the town centre anyway, so it's best to eat there. Italy itself is also expensive, you'll need £100 per day for two people to eat and drink, without eating anywhere fancy or expensive in comparison. Pompeii is well worth the 105 euros per person for the day trip there, so I would whole heartedly recommend it. All in all, I'd recommend this hotel to anyone, apart from those with children; however Rome is not suitable in any way for children in my eyes, as walking is definitely a must.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: No hot water, pool is green, no laundry service. Staff is good, but hotel is horrible. Food is overpriced and disgusting. Other hotels in the same areas offer more for less. No shuttle service unless you want to pay more than a taxi charges (which is ridiculous). No laundry service (unless you want to pay 3.00euro per pair of underwear...why not just buy new ones. Prepare to have a hot room, no matter how many times you tell the staff to turn the AC on. This hotel overall has been the worst one we have stayed in. Out of 2 weeks we only stayed in the actual room for a week.. the other week we stayed at nicer hotels for cheaper, this room was just to keep our luggage. Good luck if you choose this hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: Black Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Via Sardiello 18 | Centre - Aurelio, 00165 Rome, Italy
